overview:
A fellow member of Institute of Chartered Accountants of India, Mr. Ghosal started his career in 1984 with Siemens Ltd and held leadership positions in Corporate Finance & Commercial with a small stint in international market as well. He has also worked with Escorts finance, moving on to GE capital where he was the core team member to set up the first captive BPO in the country. His last stint was with Times of India as Director Finance & was on the board of several companies of the group.

Achievements

  • JVs with international media companies.
  • Orchestrating the ‘Private Equity’ partnership model through investment in equity/acquisition/performance based revenue sharing for various customers in different sectors.
  • IPO of the Times Group’s radio business subsidiary in domestic market Played a key role in International funding for Internet/ Technology business.
